content.description: This climb traverses the entire wall.Â Sit start matched with both hands on the shelf, make a few moves up and left on incuts then continue the leftward movement along the rest of the boulder. The crux comes just before the left arete, and is then followed by a somewhat tricky topout.
content.protection: 4 pads and 2 spotters. There is potential to land on your back.
content.location: This climb is on the downhill overhang of the boulder and starts on the obvious shelf rail.

content.description: Sit start matched on a large shelf. Pull on and move up and left to some incuts and then encounter a crux topout. It is puzzling.
content.protection: 3 or 4 pads. The top out is nails.
content.location: This climb is on the right side of the overhang starting on the obvious shelf. It heads left a bit but tops out more or less directly from the start.

content.description: This is a good sized boulder with an old obscure climb and a new climb that traverses the whole overhang. Many people barely notice this sweet boulder even though it is right behind the "B.F.B."
